00030 #define COMPATIBILITY_V25               1                       // Enable compatibility with MIDI Library v2.5
00031 
00032 
00033 #define COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN        1           // Set this setting to 1 to use the MIDI input.
00034 #define COMPFLAG_MIDI_OUT       1           // Set this setting to 1 to use the MIDI output. 
00035 
00036 
00037 #if USE_USB_CONNECTION
00038   #define USE_SERIAL_PORT       Serial      // This Serial port is the one connected to the USB plug.
00039 #else
00040   #define USE_SERIAL_PORT       Serial1     // Change the number (to Serial1 for example) if you want
00041 #endif                                      // to use a different serial port for MIDI I/O.
00042 
00043 
00044 #define USE_RUNNING_STATUS              1                       // Running status enables short messages when sending multiple values
00045                                             // of the same type and channel.
00046                                             // Set to 0 if you have troubles with controlling you hardware.
00047

00049 // END OF CONFIGURATION AREA

00056 #define MIDI_BAUDRATE                   31250
00057 
00058 
00059 #define MIDI_CHANNEL_OMNI               0
00060 #define MIDI_CHANNEL_OFF                17 // and over
00061 
00062 #define MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE   255
00063 
00065 typedef uint8_t byte;
00066 
00068 enum kMIDIType {
00069         NoteOff               = 0x80,   // Note Off
00070         NoteOn                = 0x90,   // Note On
00071         AfterTouchPoly        = 0xA0,   // Polyphonic AfterTouch
00072         ControlChange         = 0xB0,   // Control Change / Channel Mode
00073         ProgramChange         = 0xC0,   // Program Change
00074         AfterTouchChannel     = 0xD0,   // Channel (monophonic) AfterTouch
00075         PitchBend             = 0xE0,   // Pitch Bend
00076         SystemExclusive       = 0xF0,   // System Exclusive
00077         TimeCodeQuarterFrame  = 0xF1,   // System Common - MIDI Time Code Quarter Frame
00078         SongPosition          = 0xF2,   // System Common - Song Position Pointer
00079         SongSelect            = 0xF3,   // System Common - Song Select
00080         TuneRequest           = 0xF6,   // System Common - Tune Request
00081         Clock                 = 0xF8,   // System Real Time - Timing Clock
00082         Start                 = 0xFA,   // System Real Time - Start
00083         Continue              = 0xFB,   // System Real Time - Continue
00084         Stop                  = 0xFC,   // System Real Time - Stop
00085         ActiveSensing         = 0xFE,   // System Real Time - Active Sensing
00086         SystemReset           = 0xFF,   // System Real Time - System Reset
00087         InvalidType           = 0x00    // For notifying errors
00088 };
00089 
00091 enum kThruFilterMode {
00092         Off                   = 0,  // Thru disabled (nothing passes through).
00093         Full                  = 1,  // Fully enabled Thru (every incoming message is sent back).
00094         SameChannel           = 2,  // Only the messages on the Input Channel will be sent back.
00095         DifferentChannel      = 3   // All the messages but the ones on the Input Channel will be sent back.
00096 };
00097 
00098 
00100 struct midimsg {
00102         byte channel; 
00104         kMIDIType type;
00106         byte data1;
00108         byte data2;
00110         byte sysex_array[MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE];
00112         bool valid;
00113 };

00174

00181         byte getData1();
00182         byte getData2();
00183         byte * getSysExArray();
00184         bool check();
00185         
00186         byte getInputChannel() { return mInputChannel; }
00187         
00188         // Setters
00189         void setInputChannel(const byte Channel);
00190         
00191 private:
00192         
00193         inline const kMIDIType getTypeFromStatusByte(const byte inStatus) {
00194                 if ((inStatus < 0x80) 
00195                         || (inStatus == 0xF4) 
00196                         || (inStatus == 0xF5) 
00197                         || (inStatus == 0xF9) 
00198                         || (inStatus == 0xFD)) return InvalidType; // data bytes and undefined.
00199                 if (inStatus < 0xF0) return (kMIDIType)(inStatus & 0xF0);       // Channel message, remove channel nibble.
00200                 else return (kMIDIType)inStatus;
00201         }
00202         
00203         bool filter(byte inChannel);
00204         bool parse(byte inChannel);
00205         
00206         
00207         // Attributes
00208         byte                    mRunningStatus_RX;
00209         byte                    mInputChannel;
00210         
00211         byte                    mPendingMessage[MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE];
00212         byte                    mPendingMessageExpectedLenght;
00213         byte                    mPendingMessageIndex;
00214         
00215         midimsg                 mMessage;
00216         
00217 #endif // COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN
00218         
00219 
00220 /* ####### THRU COMPILATION BLOCK ####### */
00221 #if (COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN && COMPFLAG_MIDI_OUT) // Thru
00222         
00223 public:
00224         
00225         // Getters
00226         kThruFilterMode getFilterMode() { return mThruFilterMode; }
00227         bool getThruState() { return mThruActivated; }
00228         
00229         
00230         // Setters
00231         void turnThruOn(kThruFilterMode inThruFilterMode = Full);
00232         void turnThruOff();
00233         
00234         void setThruFilterMode(const byte inThruFilterMode);    // For compatibility only, avoid in future programs.
00235         void setThruFilterMode(const kThruFilterMode inThruFilterMode);
00236         
00237

00242         
00243 #endif // Thru
